page.title: 01Normanby
page.content: Normanby is some 6 or 7km NNW of Scunthorpe.The area is one of contrasts.To the south west of the area there are the remains of the now redundant British Steel Corporation's Normanby Park works.The works are now being dismantled and the ground landscaped.In the north west there is Normanby Hall Country Park with its elegant Hall,peacocks and deer.It is an area of arable farming with fields of cereals,rape and potatoes but which also contains disused quarries and mines.The landscape is dominated by the iron bearing ridge to the east of the area.A ridge running from Stamford in the south of Lincolnshire ,northwards until it disappears into the Humber near Whitton.
